title: Both leagues cornering the market
subtitle: Both leagues cornering the market
body: Cornerstones of success? You'll find them at the 3 o'clock and 9 o'clock positions of infields throughout the Major Leagues. But while there are outstanding players at both first base and third base around both leagues, there are -- as is often the case -- intriguing contrasts between the National and American Leagues.  Both leagues are characterized by tandems listing to one side or the other. Like in the human brain, either the left side or the right predominates. Pairings such as the Cubs' balanced set of first baseman Derrek Lee and third baseman Aramis Ramirez are the exception.  And, right now, each league has its own featured set. At the risk of generalization -- the AL is boiling at the hot corner, and the NL is first and foremost. Handle with Gold Gloves                              Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com. author: Tom Singer
